item.title: ‘It breaks my heart’: Family mourns loss of 15-year-old killed in ATV accident
item.description: 15-year-old De'Mario Ivey was killed in an ATV accident in White Springs on the 4th of July, and now his family is mourning his loss.

item.title: Robert Bailey re-sentenced to death for murder of PCB Sergeant Kevin Kight in 2005
item.description: On March 27, 2005, Panama City Beach Sergeant Kevin Kight was shot and killed during a traffic stop.

item.title: Tropical system or not, Florida’s about to get soaked, again
item.description: NHC gives disturbance 20% chance of tropical development.

item.title: Shooting investigation leads to arrest in Cypress
item.description: The Jackson County Sheriff’s Office reported on Friday that one person has been arrested following a shooting in Cypress.

item.title: LCSO: Suspect charged with attempted murder after allegedly using machete Wednesday to attack man
item.description: A man was arrested Thursday in Leon County after allegedly attacking another man with a machete, according to the Leon County Sheriff’s Office.

item.title: Man sentenced to life in prison in 2021 Wakulla County murder at St. Marks National Wildlife Refuge
item.description: Stuart Mauney’s sentencing comes after he was found guilty in May of killing Timothy Blyth in the St. Marks Wildlife Refuge in December 2021.

item.title: Alachua man jailed after March shooting over a basketball hoop
item.description: Alachua police have arrested a suspect connected to a shooting that occurred in March.

item.title: Leon County Sheriff’s Office detention deputy arrested for allegedly bringing contraband to jail
item.description: A Leon County Sheriff’s Office detention deputy was arrested this week for allegedly bringing contraband to jail, according to the sheriff’s office.

item.title: Okaloosa authorities warn public after young girl attacked by alligator
item.description: The Okaloosa County Sheriff’s Office is warning people after a young girl was attacked by an alligator in the county.

item.title: Detained immigrants at ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ say there are worms in food and wastewater on the floor
item.description: People held at the brand new Florida immigration detention center that officials have dubbed “Alligator Alcatraz” say worms turn up in the food, toilets don’t flush and floors flood with fecal waste.

item.title: First Alert Weather: Heavy rain possible over the next two days
